name: Chandragupta Maurya
details: Founder of the Maurya Empire, known for unifying India and establishing a centralized government.

name: Ashoka the Great
details: One of the greatest emperors of India, known for spreading Buddhism across India and abroad after the Kalinga War.

name: Chandragupta I
details: Founder of the Gupta Empire, often referred to as the Golden Age of India.

name: Samudragupta
details: Regarded as one of the greatest military leaders in Indian history, expanded the Gupta Empire significantly.

name: Harsha Vardhana
details: Known for his support of Buddhism and for unifying Northern India for a short period.

name: Raja Raja Chola I
details: Expanded the Chola Empire significantly and built the Brihadeeswarar Temple in Thanjavur.

name: Krishnadevaraya
details: A prominent ruler of the Vijayanagara Empire, known for military conquests and cultural achievements.

name: Akbar the Great
details: Known for consolidating the Mughal Empire, religious tolerance, and promoting the arts and culture.

name: Shah Jahan
details: Known for commissioning the Taj Mahal and expanding the Mughal Empire.

name: Aurangzeb
details: The last powerful Mughal emperor, known for expanding the empire to its largest territorial extent.

name: Maharaja Ranjit Singh
details: Founder of the Sikh Empire, known for uniting the Sikh Confederacy and his contributions to the modernization of India.

name: Bahadur Shah II
details: The last Mughal emperor, exiled after the Indian Rebellion of 1857.

name: Maharaja Sayajirao Gaekwad III
details: Ruler of Baroda, known for his progressive policies in education, infrastructure, and social reforms.

name: Shivaji Maharaj
details: Founder of the Maratha Empire, known for his military tactics and resistance against Mughal rule.

name: Lord Mountbatten
details: The last British Viceroy of India who oversaw the partition of India and independence in 1947.
